intro: Calycera horrida, commonly known as the rough calycera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a rough texture. Its flowers are typically pink to reddish in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. Calycera horrida is often found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
